Package application

Class LinePlotter2Scene

java.lang.Object
application.LinePlotter2Scene
public class LinePlotter2Scene extends Object
Author:
clemb The controller class of the screen displayed when the user is asked to draw the lines necessary for the detection of events.

  • Method Details

    • tracelineBG

      void tracelineBG​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      These function handle the reception of the line drawn by the user by redefining what is to be done on the first two clicks after the button to draw a line is pressed. Here for the line of the left goal.
      Parameters:
      event - An FXML actionEvent

    • tracelineBD

      void tracelineBD​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Same as tracelineBG but for the line of the right goal.
      Parameters:
      event - An FXML actionEvent

    • tracelineTG

      void tracelineTG​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Same as tracelineBG but for the line of the left field border.
      Parameters:
      event - A detected FXML actionEvent

    • tracelineTD

      void tracelineTD​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Same as tracelineBG but for the line of the right field border.
      Parameters:
      event - An FXML actionEvent

    • order

      private void order()
      This function check if two points describing the lines are in the expected order, and order them if not.

    • drawlines

      void drawlines​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This function handle the press of the drawLines button and call the drawlines() function.
      Parameters:
      event - An FXML action Event

    • goback

      void goback​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This function handle the press of the Return button hand close the line drawing screen, transmitting the informations to the controller of the main screen, only if all lines have been drawn.
      Parameters:
      event - An FXML actionEvent

    • drawlines

      private void drawlines()
      This function use the LinePlotter2 Class to draw the already entered lines on the displayed frame.

    • initialization

      public void initialization​(String path, ControllerVideo controlleurV)
      This function initialize an object of this class to start drawing lines
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the video for which the lines are to be drawn
      controlleurV - The controller of the main screen

    • mat2Image

      private static javafx.scene.image.Image mat2Image​(org.opencv.core.Mat frame)
      This function convert an openCV Mat into a displayable image
      Parameters:
      frame - The Mat to be transformed into a displayable image
      Returns:
      The converted image

      A get getter for the goal lines array
